Table of Contents

Name

prtwash - a script to clean the port dirs in CRUX Linux.

Synopsis

prtwash [-p] [-s] [-d] [-t] [-a] <path>

Description

prtwash is a bash script to clean the port tree of the CRUX Linux distribution. You can clean a single directory or the entire port tree. With the given options it is possible to choose what kind of files the program should delete. A test mode is provided.
prtwash was inspired by Martin Opel's prtsweep script.

Options

By default prtsweep will NOT delete the following items in a port directory:

       ·
  • The

    Pkgfile

    •    ·
  • The sources (as stated in the Pkgfile)

    •    ·
  • The built package

    •    ·
  • The

    .

    md5sum and .footprint files

    •    ·
  • Additional files: README, FAQ, pre-install,

    post-install

All items not included in the previous list WILL be deleted (ie: the 'work' dir of pkgmk, if present).

You can choose to delete some of the above passing the proper option:

[-p]
also removes the built package

[-s]
also removes the sources

[-d]
also remove the additional files: .md5sum, .footprint, README, FAQ, pre/post-install

[-t]
test mode: displays the target files without deleting

[-a]
run in automatic mode: takes the port dirs from the /etc/prtwash.conf file and do a recursive cleaning. See CONFIGURATION for details on the configuration file. If you use this option there's no need to specify the <path> parameter.

[-h]
Display usage information

[-v]
Display version

Configuration

The configuration file is /etc/prtwash.conf. You only need this file if you want to use the -a option. prtwash.conf is a list of paths, NO comments, NO spaces.

example of /etc/prtwash.conf:

/usr/ports/base
/usr/ports/opt
/usr/ports/clc/stable
/usr/ports/clc/unstable

Examples

prtwash -a -t
do a default wash action on the entire port tree,

don't really delete the files

prtwash -a -p -s
now we're getting serious: removes

all downoaded files and built package from the entire port tree

prtwash -a -p -s -d
same as tha abobe, but also removes .md5sum, .footprint, READE, etc

prtwash -p -s /usr/ports/clc/stable/sitecopy
removes all downoaded files

and built packages from the sitecopy directory

Authors

Simone Rota <sip@varlock.com>

See Also

prtsweep(1)
